metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26961 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When DNS over HTTPS is in use, it intentionally filters RFC1918 and related IP ranges from the responses as these do not make sense coming from a DoH resolver. However when an IPv4 address was mapped through IPv6, these addresses were erroneously let through, leading to a potential DNS Rebinding attack. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83, Firefox ESR < 78.5, and Thunderbird < 78.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26961` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
